inn1.comm: good start, short ball around off stump, Amla arches his back out of the line...carries well through to Ramdin
short of a length outside off, left alone
wow, what a way to get the scoring underway. It's short of a length outside off, Amla goes onto the back foot and pings it through the covers at the top of the bounce
touch fuller this time, he leaves it alone
staying on the back foot, pushed back to the bowler
a sharp bouncer, 138kph, over middle and leg, whistles over Amla's back...encouraging signs for all concerned with pace and bounce in the opening over
takes a blow first ball, back of a length around middle and leg, he tries to work into the leg side but gets taken in the stomach
that will be a relief, he gets a run on the ball as he tucks one off his hip to deep square
full outside off, 131kph, very smart batting as he just drops it into the off side
back of  a length at off stump, defended to the on side
goes chasing at this one, pushed across full outside off, no footwork and he's playing well away from his body
much more controlled this time, the ball was slightly closer to off stump and he was nice forward into the shot as he drove it wide of mid off
short of a length outside off, hint of swing but needs to be fuller, punched to cover
gets across onto off stump, tucks this through wide midwicket and it's deep square can't stop the second
short outside leg stump, poor bouncer, called wide
full on the stumps, worked wide of the short midwicket
changes to round the wicket, and well bowled...beats the outside edge with a full one outside off which nips away off the seam and catches Rossouw flat-footed
shorter delivery, 135kph, slightly awkwardly played as he was initially shaping for a full-blooded pull but bailed out and just paddled it to deep square
on the hip, tucked out to deep square
full outside off, 132kph, left alone
drives on the up into the covers
tight line, full outside off, defended on the front foot
fuller, driven firmly to mid off
short, angled towards leg stump, Amla hooks and although he's not entirely in control the top edge flies well over short fine leg
full again, driven to mid on
round the wicket, full outside off, pushed firmly into the covers from the front foot
strong wrists from Amla as he flicks this from off stump through midwicket
another sweetly-struck drive on the up which goes to mid off
gets across right outside off and flicks this delivery to short midwicket
very full at off stump and effortlessly driven straight of mid off, not the full flourish just more of a punch
drags the length back, he's on the back foot this time and again this whistles off the middle of the bat to mid off...he looks in fantastic order today
on leg stump, takes the pad towards square leg
short outside off, a rare occasion where Amla doesn't quite get his timing right and the ball rolls into the covers
lovely placement, toying with the field as he whips this full delivery from off stump backward of square on the leg side
comes off the bottom of the bat towards cover
drives on the up, goes square to point
touch fuller outside off, defended back to the bowler
short from round the wicket, the pull isn't controlled and lobs in the air but falls well in front of deep square
short on leg stump, Amla gets inside the line and whips it off his hip wide of deep square leg
just short of a length, it's driven on the up and the bottom hand comes off the bat
a bouncer at 141kph which Amla ducks
short of a length on off stump, Amla on his toes and punches it into the covers
poor line, short on leg stump and it's a freebie for Amla just to flick away fine
full outside off, left alone
wider outside off, another one through to the keeper
short delivery around off stump, doesn't quite come off the pitch and Rossouw helps it into the leg side
using the crease again, he's across outside off and fetching this into the leg side
full and wide outside off, goes for the drive and it skews down to third man
that races off the bat as he flicks it off the stumps behind square, deep square has to be alert even though he only has a few steps to make to his right
over the wicket, full outside off, flicked to midwicket
same again, can't beat midwicket as there's a good diving save
touch shorter outside off, defended square to the off side
some turn into the left hander, played off the back foot to the leg side
onto the front foot, worked into the leg side and can't find a gap
not quite a maiden as he tucks this into square leg
lovely piece of timing and placement, that will boost Rossouw, as he leans forward and drives a length delivery through point on the up
short of a length, whipped from off stump into the leg side
flicked from outside off to deep square
defended to short cover
short outside off stump, Rossouw has plenty of time to pull it through straight midwicket...brings up the fifty stand, without a major alarm

nearly pops a catch to point, interesting delivery as it seems to hold in the pitch a touch, he rolled his fingers across the ball, Rossouw was early on his shot but just managed to send the ball to ground
very short outside off but only costs a single as it's cut to deep cover
goes down on his back knee and paddles a low full toss through short fine leg
full outside off, flicked down to long on
angled in from round the wicket, defended to the leg side
touch short outside off, cut through point and the sweeper is quick enough to stop the second
played off the back foot to Gayle at short midwicket
not a great start, short and wide outside off, cut in front of point with power but deep cover is quick
angled across outside off, driven to mid off
defended from outside off to mid on
not far from find deep square running towards deep midwicket, it was a short ball around off stump, got quite big on Rossouw who couldn't roll his wrists on the pull
short again, over middle and leg, Amla ducks
short of a length, good pace at 143kph, Amla hops onto the back foot to defend
paddled around the corner, premeditated shot, and it may have come off the glove
tucked to deep square
full on the stumps and worked to long on
opens the face and dabs this onto backward point, Benn not happy at the single being allowed
opens the face as he drives but can't beat Gayle at short cover
more power in this drive and it bursts through Gayle's hands, the pace taken off the shot means long off can't get in fast enough to stop the second
dragged down short and hammered out to deep midwicket with a front-foot pull
short delivery which he ducks
short of a length outside off, tries to work it into the leg side but only gets it back to the bowler
works a straight delivery out to deep square
short of a length outside off, driven from the back foot to cover
fuller, going across the left hander, driven neatly to deep cover
worked from well outside off back to Benn
some invention from Rossouw, brings out the reverse sweep and gets it fine of short third man...more anger from Benn who doesn't think that should have been three
short outside off, on the back foot and placed to deep cover
defended to midwicket

given lbw, playing the reverse sweep again, but Rossouw reviews straight away which suggests he thinks he's hit it. Will have to be a bottom edge if so. Yes, the side-on reply shows a deflection off the bat. The ball changes angle, although snicko is less convincing! This could still be interesting. Remember, needs conclusive evidence. I'd suggest the straight slow-mo replay should be enough. No Hot Spot available. And it's overturned. West Indies aren't happy - Benn and Holder speaking to the umpire.
dragged down short outside off, no timing as he pulls...Benn fields and is clearly an angry man at the moment
135kph, flicked to mid on
signs of a little frustration? Amla throws his full weight into driving at this ball and doesn't make contact
well, that will help...dropped short and Amla is quickly into position to pull in front of square
and short again, this time the pull isn't quite as well timed and finds deep square
responds to the short deliveries being scored off with an even shorter bouncer which is called wide
goes full, pushed towards mid off who is too deep to stop the single
awful delivery, spray way down the leg side, tough take for Ramdin who does well to cut it off...pitched on the popping crease
leg side again, flicked off the pads to deep square
angled into middle and leg, flicked to short fine leg
full on the stumps, eased to long on
onto the back foot, punched towards midwicket where Gayle tumbles and can't field cleanly...he went down in instalments
cut into the off side
full and flicked down the ground
worked out to deep square leg
good placement from Amla as Russell drops short outside off, slotted wide of mid-off and although it doesn't quite have the legs tor reach the boundary it's enough to bring up another fifty
short on the hip, flicked to long leg
punched off the back foot to the left of mid-off
short again, taken from outside off to midwicket
fuller delivery, pushed down to long on
short outside off, 135kph, Amla drops his hands and lets it go through
misses his attempt to dab this into the off side, the ball skidded through low
worked wide of midwicket
driven down to long off
goes to sweep/paddle this but can't beat square leg
worked out to deep square
goes for a drive, comes off a thick outside edge towards short third man
short of a length outside off, punched firmly back to the bowler
a fuller delivery, driven to mid off
dragged down short and at Sammy's pace that's an easy delivery to put away as Rossouw pulls powerfully through square leg
taken from full outside off down to long on to raise the hundred stand...another tick for South Africa
dabbed down to third man
round the wicket, tucked off the stumps to midwicket
starts with an awful short delivery which Amla pulls backward of square
worked off the pads to deep square
better delivery, tossed up outside off, left alone
short and cut to deep cover
round the wicket, good placement from Amla as he takes advantage of the length and cuts between backward point and short third man
walks across the crease and takes this into the leg side...placement is perfect, again, which allows a second. So skillful
round the wicket, more excellent placement, this time from Rossouw as he takes this from outside off into square leg
crunched! Too short, too wide and Rossouw dispatches it in front of square through cover to take him to his half-century. Been a very good innings.
now there's some nice timing, punched off the back foot straight down the ground...looked like two off the bat, but Amla was a little on the back foot as he made sure the ball passed the stumps
guided down to third man
back round the wicket, mixing up the angle, fuller on the stumps and driven straight down the pitch
beats him with a full slower ball outside off that he tries to play square
turned off the stumps into midwicket
driven to cover
onto the front foot, opens the face into the point area
short on leg stump, into the leg side
driven wide of mid off
close! Driven in the air, didn't come out of the middle, flies just wide of short cover down to long off
worked from outside off into midwicket, Sammy does the chasing himself
short of a length outside off, another slower ball, flicked backward of square
full on middle and off, defended
defends with an open face and finds point
whipped off the pads to deep square
full from round the wicket, clubbed firmly down the ground
short outside off and he finds the gap through cover, another poor delivery from Samuels but it still needed to be placed wide of the sweeper
quicker ball, harder shot! Goes down on one knee and picks up a full ball from outside of and slog-sweeps over deep midwicket
fast and short from Samuels, mistimed back to the bowler
driven to deep cover
short outside leg stump, gently flicked to deep square
well, gets one past the edge! Nicely bowled, it turned significantly from a good length
full on off stump, bunted to mid off
short outside off, back-cut down to third man
hammered! Short outside off from round the wicket, Rossouw coming down the pitch and flat-bats this wide of mid-off from the top of the bounce
short again, pulled through midwicket this time
full on the stumps, worked to deep square
slower ball outside off, struck firmly to cover
good length outside off, 140kph, pushed to the covers
full on the stumps, squeezed away off a thickish inside edge to deep square
round the wicket, back of a length, pushed to mid on
full outside off, sliced away high over backward point as he swings with all his power, flies towards third man where there is a woeful attempt to field it by Samuels. Shambles.
low full toss which is heaved to deep square
gets neatly inside the line of a short delivery and pulls down to long leg where Samuels isn't looking overly interested in proceedings
full and driven back to the bowler
full and driven into the off side
quick and flat outside off, pushed down the pitch
takes it from outside off into the vast open spaces on the leg side, placed wide of long on
beats him with a quicker ball at 98kph which skids on outside off...too quick for Ramdin to take, too
nudged into midwicket again and this made and racing between the wickets to make it another brace
back of a length at off stump, plays with soft hands and the ball drops by his feet to allow the single
fantastic placement, it wasn't a bad delivery, good length outside off and Rossouw came forward into the delivery then punched it so sweetly between cover and mid off
drags this down short, a powerful pull behind square but Johnson shows good pace in the outfield
full toss on the stumps pushed out to deep midwicket

nearly a run out! A full delivery was pinged back down the pitch by Amla, it was close to the bowler's hand and the stumps so Rossouw had to make sure he was back in his ground which meant he was slow to take off the for the run. There was confusion, then Amla kept coming so Rossouw had to go for it and a direct hit from the replay throw via the bowler to the keeper would have had Rossouw short
pushes to cover and takes the chance for a deep breath
uses his feet then pushes to midwicket
goes back to a short delivery and picks out point with his cut
can't beat midwicket as he flicks this off his toes
short again outside off, cut to deep cover
over the wicket, drifts onto leg stump and flicked to deep backward square leg

lovely delivery! Turns to beat the outside edge as Amla plays forward. They appeal for the stumping and it's gone upstairs to see if the back foot dragged. It's pretty close. He did lift for a fraction of a second. Looks safe, though.
good length just outside off, dropped into the covers for an easy single
around the wicket, only slightly short of a length, Amla tries to pull and misses, the ball going not too far over the off stump
forward a foot outside off, across his stumps, tapped out through square leg
length sliding across the leftie who waits in the crease and carves out to deep cover, not wide enough of the fielder for a second
back over the wicket, short just outside off, Amla waits and tries to uppercut but doesn't really get hold of it and it lands well short of third man
low full toss, carved out wide of the cover sweeper and they get back for a second here
full on the off stump, worked out through square leg
similar delivery to the left-hander, nudged out wide of mid-on for another single
further outside off, driven off a thick inside edge wide of midwicket and they get an overthrow after Benn's throw cannoned the bowler's stumps
forward press to a straighter ball down to long-on
foot outside off, rolled to the right hand of mid-off and they get an easy single
fuller length, driven inside mid-off and they get another single
touch full just outside off, timed up towards mid-off but should have been cut off by extra-cover rushing to his right, nice shot though, mid-off didn't have much of a chance
drops the length and Amla slips across the off stump to tap into square leg
down the track but slaps a length ball straight to extra-cover
straight enough line to pull and plays it well but well saved at deep square by Johnson tumbling to his left
full just outside off, nudged into the off side, extra-cover and mid-off come in and collide! Allowing the ball to slip away from both of them! Goodness the fielding has been poor
very full on off stump, flicked out down to long-off
around the wicket, clipped in the air and almost to Gayle at extra-cover, got it high on the bat
fuller length, played carefully back to the bowler who fields going to his left
full length just outside off, Rossow gets across his stumps to work up on the on side for a quick single
any chance to clip leg side Amla gobbles up, does so again here working a ball from off stump through square
short and pulled, will this be it? No, Smith runs to his left to cut it off

back of a length, pulled out to deep midwicket and Rossouw roars his delight at reaching a maiden ODI hundred, answering the critics in fine style here, he looks a little emotional too, and brings the 200 up
full and down the leg side, Rossouw misses looking to flick it away
length ball on the stumps, this is worked to the left hand of midwicket

wide full line, driven past backward point and this beats third man to the fence and there's Amla hundred too! Amla is almost unstoppable at the moment, calmly raises his bat, run of the mill for him really!
Smith responds with a bumper which is ducked
wide line again, this time Amla can only flick it down to third man
pushes the line across the leftie's off stump, cut out to deep point
cutter, waited for in the crease and driven out to deep cover
around the wicket, off stump line, Amla back away and cuts wide of the off side sweeper to bring them a second
full length on off stump, driven steadily down to long-off
over the wicket, full toss on middle and leg, whipped out wide of the leg side sweeper and they come back for the second again, the fielding in the deep not the best, Benn very unimpressed
full length on middle and off, Rossouw gets his front leg out of the way to steer a drive wide of extra-cover
more air, pitched on off stump and gripped past the outside edge, lovely bowling
fuller and this is nudged through cover for a single
back of a length just outside off stump, angled down to third man
low full toss just outside off, carved through point and beats the sweeper running to his right
now drops the length and Rossouw rocks back to pull over square leg, lovely timing, it sailed way back
yorker just outside off, dug out down to long-on
tries to flick a full ball from well outside off through the leg side but gets a leading edge in the air for a while but short and wide of extra-cover
backs away to leg aiming over extra-cover but mistimes this straight to the fielder
straight line, down the track and flicks right across the line, gets it to the backward square rope
down the track and cracks this on the bounce to long-off
reverse swept off the leg stump to short long leg
straight line, miscued leg side and it chips in the air but short of deep square running in
gives himself a little room to the leg side and drives from off stump past a diving point who half-saves, ball runs out towards the cover rope
straighter line, flicked leg side and they get a single behind square leg
around the wicket, low full toss on the stumps, cracked leg side and almost gets it for a flat six to the short boundary
step down the wicket, meets this on the full too and whacks it straight over the bowler's head, four more, good club again

half-volley on off stump and this is chipped straight to mid-off! A wicket finally falls, not sure what Rossouw was trying to do, didn't go hell for leather to get it over the infield, almost just stroked it and it flew at waist height to the fielder for an easy catch, so the record stand ends but what a knock from Rossouw
full delivery just outside off, slower ball, picks it up and slaps down the ground inside mid-on
slightly tighter line, driven at again, this takes a thick outside edge which flies down to third man on a few bounces
fuller length, angled down to third man
full length on the off stump, nudged through cover for an easy single
yorker on off stump, dug out through square leg
off stump line, de Villiers steps away to leg and lifts over mid-off, timed well enough
steps off side this time and pulls over square leg, what a shot! Slightly back of a length but far from a back ball, de Villiers times it so well
fuller length, clears the front leg and slaps is wide and over mid-off once more, brilliant batting
gets down on one knee almost outside off stump and scoops it over backward square! It carries all the way for six. He almost lifted it over his shoulder! How do you bowl against this?
full on the leg stump, tucked down to long leg, happy to give de Villiers the strike!
doesn't matter where the fielders are with this bowling, low full toss on off stump blasted over long-off, poor ball but emphatically put away
low and behold, tried to back to the leg side, slower ball, de Villiers inside edges back to the bowler
backs to the leg side, bowler follows him and bowls a decent yorker, dug out down to long leg, de Villiers doesn't know where the ball has gone but when he realises, charges back for the second
steps to leg again, followed again, short this time, slapped down but wide of deep midwicket, two more
tries to reverse paddle this time and misses a full ball, runs off the pad to square leg
very full just outside off, whacked straight down to long-on
excellent yorker, just dug out on the off side for a single
steps across the off stump and lifts a full toss over backward square leg, another incredible shot, so far across off and helps it into the stands
length on off stump, smashed down the ground and into the stands!! There's the record. A gorgeous clean strike over long-off, such timing
fuller length, slapped down the ground, hasn't got this at all, is long-on going to get there? No! It falls over his head over the rope, the thin air took that for six
full and wide now and carved over cover, four more
low full toss but just knocked down to long-off
short at the body, hooked at, bit of a top edge but it doesn't matter, sails way back into the stands over fine leg
yorker on leg stump, dug out only as far as deep square along the floor

full just outside off, nudged straight to backward point, they take on the fielder with a sharp single, throw comes into the striker's end, de Villiers was back even with a direct hit and there's no backing up and it runs for four overthrows!
low full toss, this time de Villers is down low to steer an 85mph ball past short third man, what bravely really to reverse paddle that from leg stump
slower ball, back of a length, follows de Villiers stepping back to leg but he only pulls out to deep midwicket
yorker a foot outside off, de Villiers aiming leg side gets an inside edge into the pad, runs off towards point
steps away to leg and carves a full ball from just outside over point, timed well, that's the area with everyone up on the off side
slower ball, goes off side once again, mistimes this drive over mid-off but even with a dive to his left the fielder can't get there, just enough bat
length at the body, steered down to long leg
very full on the stumps, slapped straight back to the bowler
high full toss, de Villiers backs away and slaps this off side, gets a thick outside edge past Ramdin's right hand
full length, swung down the ground inside long-on and just carries onto the boundary hoarding does it? No just short
full on the stumps, swung down the ground inside long-on for a couple
slower ball, nudged leg side and they get two more before deep midwicket can charge in
yorker a foot outside off, missed
full just outside off, swung at and gets a thick inside edge out to deep square
nicely bowled, followed the batsman backing to leg, yorker right at the batsman's heels and de Villiers can do nothing with it
does something with this though, shuffling right across his stumps once more to lift over backward-square leg, picked up perfectly and it flies into the stands again
nice yorker wide of off stump, reached out for and missed
slightly tighter line, driven straight to extra-cover
full length on the stumps, misses the yorker and this is swung down the ground, beautiful smooth strike through the line, only just short of another six, into the 90s now
steps across the stumps and lifts a six over backward square again, bowler misses the yorker again and gets punished once more
around the wicket, full just outside off, de Villiers slog sweeps it over deep midwicket and there it is!! The fastest ODI century. What an incredible knock
full on the stumps and it sails away again! Now it's the record for most sixes in an innings by a South African in an ODI. Straight back over the bowler's head this time
full on the stumps clipped out to deep midwicket and they charge back for the second
cramps Amla up with a length ball, works this out to deep midwicket just a single this time
excellent yorker - off the pad wide of the keeper
full delivery just outside off, slapped down the ground without timing but it actually allows them to get back for the second
driven off side this time, to mid-off's left and they take an easy single
full length right at the stumps, de Villiers back away to leg and swung hard over the off side, it carries over the deep point fence! How did that go for six? It sailed away once more, mad stuff here
length at the off stump, slapped to mid-off, no need for a throw and it cannons off the non-striker's stumps and goes for an overthrow
gorgeous shot, steps to leg a little and drives powerfully past extra-cover, 150 partnership of just 54 deliveries! 400 raised too
slower ball, Amla across his stumps looking to steer this leg side, runs off the pad to short long leg
goes for the reverse paddle but gets a toe-end from a yorker to backward point
slower ball bouncer, Amla goes to hook and misses, really well bowled, brave too
beautiful, gives himself room to hit off side and strokes this over extra-cover, lovely timing, highest career ODI score for Amla now
whoops, yorker missed, de Villiers whacks it over wide midwicket, timed so well
length now, back to pull and it carries towards the same boundary and just clears the long boundary and the tallest man on the field, Benn
excellent yorker just outside off but de Villiers digs it out and squirts it past short long leg, that is very unlucky for the bowler
as good as the last ball was, this is pants, back of length, pulled over square leg, nailed it once more, everything has been nailed
full on the off stump, yorker missed, and it disappears over long-off, this is ridiculous, lovely flowing stroke, it goes way back
slower ball on the stumps, slapped leg side, to the right of deep midwicket and they get back for the second
length on off stump, punched back up the wicket past the bowler for a single
full just outside off, lifted over point, not timed perfectly, they get back for two and that's South Africa's highest ODI score
around the wicket, full length wide of off stump, de Villiers missed completely

fuller length, smashed over the off side but straight to deep cover! Finally de Villiers finds the fielder but there was no luck in this absolutely outrageous innings. Couldn't find the gap this time, it was a firm strike but straight to the fielder. The record-breaker departs
full just outside off, flicked leg side and missed
full length wide of off stump and missed again

inn2.comm: boundary first up, back of a length delivery which Smith goes to pull and gets a bottom edge over the stumps and wide of the keeper
wide outside off, Smith chases it but doesn't make contact and Steve Davis stretches out his arms
picks him out! Straight to third man...but it's a no-ball! A let off for Smith as he upper cut this straight to Philander who barely had to move
keeps it short, Gayle moves to leg and heaves away a pull which, although not cleanly timed, has the legs to beat deep square
that's a lovely delivery, pushed across on off stump and it jags away from Gayle's edge, misses it by a mile in the end
another no-ball, poor start from Morkel, it's short of a length outside off and sliced down to third man
gives himself a touch of room, it's outside off and carved over point...the running isn't great
fuller on middle and off, defended
has a big swing at a full delivery, gets a thick inside edge into his boot which then rolls to the off side
full on middle, pushed firmly to mid on
clubs a length ball from off stump, one bounce to mid on
short on leg stump, he pulls and gets it just fine of a diving de Villiers off some glove or inside edge although replays suggest it was just pad
full again, walks into a defensive push
good line, tight on the stumps, nothing for him to free his arms against, defended to the leg side
back of a length, worked to midwicket
short of a length across Gayle who tries to guide down to third man and gets beaten
driven off the back foot wide of mid-off
fuller delivery, angling into the stumps, takes an inside edge into the pad
full, into the pads again, slanting into the batsman who missed out
stands on leg stump, it's a length delivery which he drives to mid off
full outside off, slices it in the air over backward point having stayed on, or outside, leg stump to give himself room
short outside off, no timing from Gayle as he slices it into the ground and it dribbles to the covers
back of a length, Smith shapes to pull and the ball scoots under his bat...a hint of variable bounce
a rather ungainly heave down the ground
full and very wide outside off, Gayle is across the crease trying to reach it but the umpire still calls it wide
sliced over the off-side in field, was short of a length and again the timing wasn't there from Gayle as it came off near the top of the bat
gets more wood on this one, fetches a delivery from well outside off and heaves it straight of mid on
that one is very clean...pitched up outside off, Gayle stands there and lofts it over long on. The full stuff is going to go by the looks of it
back of a length, gets an inside edge trying to play into the leg side
back of a length outside off, 147kph, Smith winds up for a powerful shot over the off side but doesn't connect
fuller on off stump, he gets himself onto the front foot and pushes out to deep square
very well bowled, went full with a change of pace, 130kph, blocked by Gayle who had to adjust late

that's the end of that! Keeping it short of a length has done the trick, Gayle got too far underneath the shot as he tried to pull over deep midwicket, but it still took a very well judged catch from  Behardien in the deep as he had to adjust at the last moment
full outside off, Smith plays it into the pitch by his feet...thought of a single but de Villiers quickly up to the stumps
pushed across outside off, left alone
good delivery, full at off stump, hint of shape back into him as he defends
tucked off the pads to short fine leg
full, neatly pushed down the ground straight of mid-off
they nearly went up for an lbw appeal, but there was an inside edge before pad as this nipped back at Smith
giving himself a touch of room, pushes a back-of-a-length delivery wide of mid off
starts full, Smith again falling across a delivery as he aims to the leg side
angled into leg stump, clipped to deep square
loose shot outside off, the ball angled across him and it was a half-hearted poke away from his body
very similar delivery and this time Johnson leaves well alone
and now there's another flashy drive, gets beaten, although there was also a lack of bounce this time as the ball jagged away off a crack
keeps it full outside off, 138kph, left alone...good over from Steyn
back of a length, pulled in front of square off the front foot...another swift piece of fielding from Behardien
full, slower ball, Smith gives himself some room then lofts it over mid off
drags the length back, 130kph, defended
full and straight, blocked back to the bowler
excellent stroke, takes advantage of a shorter delivery which sits up nicely and gives him the chance to crack it over the off side
attempted slow ball, I think, which went wrong and slipped well down the leg side
now a very short bouncer, Vern loses it for a moment
gets back on a good length, pushed into the off side with an open blade
flicked off the pads to deep square
full outside off, left alone
and another flashy drive which almost brings edge, the ball was actually shorter than the previous one and certainly wasn't there for such a shot
sharp bouncer, 144kph, well directed over middle and off which defeats Johnson's attempt to hook
pushed wider outside off, he chases it without footwork, and in fact too wide for the umpire's liking. Steyn somewhat miffed at that call
gets back around off stump, defended to the leg side
outside off, through to the keeper
full outside off, no holding back as he drives in the air over the off side field...swung away from Smith but he was fully committed
ah, that's a beauty! Full again and creamed down the ground straight of mid-off, that pinged off the middle
tucks a length ball into midwicket
full outside off, he walks into a drive which finds cover

swings back into the left hander and looked pretty good! Johnson opts for the review, hoping it pitched outside leg. No-ball is fine. Struck on the knee roll. Pitches well inside the line, smashing middle and leg. Johnson completely worked over by Steyn and Philander.
full at off stump, drives into the covers
pushed into the leg side
moves to the leg side and hammers a drive to mid off
full on off stump, pushed into a gap at cover
short of a length, takes the pad down to fine leg, not entirely sure a shot was played but the umpire allows the leg bye
full on the stumps, closes the face and works wide of midwicket
full on off stump, 141kph, played square to point
pretty flat on off stump, pushed to cover
short on leg stump, flicked out to deep square leg
fuller delivery, flicked back to the bowler
effortless drive, it was pushed across outside off and Samuels just leant onto it to place it down the ground...long on is out, but not long off
tucked to deep square...a jogged single
dragged down short and he latches on as he pulls through square leg
full on off stump, straightens on Samuels, defended towards backward point and almost a mix-up over a possible single
good bouncer, 138kph, and Samuels sways out of the line
full on middle and off, pushed to mid on
well bowled, beats him with a full one outside off as Samuels' feet remains stuck in the crease after the earlier short ball
another good delivery, short of a length this time as he works of Samuels who pulls the bat inside the line
pushes this short delivery down the leg side
outside off, left alone
full on middle, he leans forward and defends
a googly, skids on, beats the inside edge and takes the pad...big appeal from Tahir, but it was sliding down leg
shorter delivery, driven into the ground and it bounces over Tahir to long off
was this a chance? Samuels going for the drive, de Villiers can't gather it. Perhaps not. Nice delivery, though
driven firmly to cover on the edge of the circle
full on middle, carefully patted to the off side
swing and a miss outside off
short of a length outside off, opens the face to third man
touch fuller at off stump, blocked to the covers
short outside off, he upper cuts again towards third man but this time it's wide of Philander and on the bounce
appeal for lbw as this nips and takes the front pad but it was going down the leg side, high as well
flamboyant drive at a wider ball outside off, defeated by the pace and some extra bounce
full on the stumps, pressed down the ground to long-on
flicked down the ground again
better length, blocked back to the bowler
fuller again, flicked down to long-on once more
more air and whipped out wide of long-on this time so they can take two
down the track, not quite to the pitch, rather skewed off a drive down to long-off
back of a length well wide of off stump, left alone
fuller on the off stump, Samuels backing away carves this out to deep cover
short and wide and nicely cut over backward point, Smith through to fifty, played a handy knock
slightly tighter line, goes to uppercut again but it bounces a little and beat the outside edge
fuller and tighter, blocked back to the bowler
slightly wider line gives Smith the invitation to try and swing it over the off side but he connects only with fresh air
tossed up on the stumps, Samuels out of his ground with a step to flick down to long-on
swept off leg stump and missed, cry for lbw but it was sliding down. Brief chat but no review
slider, seen and knocked up the wicket
thrown up and belted down the ground, long-off comes to his right and makes a nice save with a slide, du Plessis with some excellent work
this time goes over long-off and times it very well, sails over the fielder into the stand, nice use of the feet
covers up this time back in the crease
full at the pads, runs off for a leg bye wide of the keeper
backs away and guides a length ball from off stump down to third man
a little too full of length on off stump, smeared to mid-off, Smith is annoyed with himself, should have put that away
wider line and cut wide of third man, just a single, can't help but feel better running would have brought a second there
steps away to leg, Morkel follows him with a full delivery, Samuels cramped can only drive to mid-on
also backs to leg, slower ball on off stump, carved only to point
around the wicket, slog swept from off stump wide of long-on, slapped away to good effect, boundaries desperately needed
tad short and pulled over deep midwicket onto the grass bank, nicely played, rocking back and got the length
short and slightly wide, cut wide of the sweeper but again the running is so lackadaisical it's only a single
waited for and late cut from off stump but straight to short third man
fuller, good stride in and pressed down to long-off
forward just outside off now, nudging this to point
full length just outside off, smashed wide of long-off, powerful drive and in the gap
clears the front leg and tries to go again, fresh air to a ball wide of off
full length well wide of off stump, reached for with a swipe and misses by a long chalk
more of a length ball, tighter line, Samuels tries to late cut and misses
similar line, fuller length, carved at wide of the deep point and they get back for two
yorker length, right on the guideline outside off but this is judged too wide
wide outside off again, this is late cut and missed again
full length on off stump, blocked back to the bowler

similar delivery, this time tried to be swung down the ground and doesn't time it, tough chance for long-off running to his right but takes the catch. Makes it look easy in the end. The medium pace was too tempting for Smith and he miscued the straight lofted drive and no amount of thin air was taking that for six
length on the stumps, tucked into the leg side and they run hard for once and get back for the second
full length just outside off, driven out to deep cover
full on a straight line, pressed down to long-on
slightly too straight now and whipped out to deep square leg
full length driven off a thick inside edge through midwicket
hangs back in the crease to carve this full delivery from just outside off to deep cover-point
tighter line and just pressed up to cover
similar ball, this time dabbed up towards mid-on
length ball skids through a bit low outside off stump, bounces to the keeper
tighter line and better line, beats the outside edge with Ramdin trying to angle down to third man
a foot wide of off stump, driven out to deep cover
a little leg stumpish, worked out to deep midwicket
poor ball, too wide and too short, easily cut out past point
another ball to try and cut, this time finds cover only
straighter line, tapped to square leg
a foot outside off, played from the crease straight to backward point
foot wide of off stump, tries to late cut, gets it off a thick under edge towards point, Ramdin calls an easy single in the end
short and well wide of off stump, it moves away a little and called wide
nice shot, eased down the ground, this is very well timed past mid-on and runs away to the rope, got a good stride in there
wider line and fuller, this time slapped through extra-cover, timed well again
forward press from the stumps inside mid-on for a short single
right on line here, it nibbles away a little and beats the outside edge

full and wide, Samuels drives off balance and finds extra-cover! Who leaps above his head to take a smart catch. Samuels reaching out for this, got into a poor position to try and drive it away and found the fielder
straight ball tickled to short long leg, they take on the fielder and get home comfortably
full length just outside off, driven out to deep cover, 150 limps up
full length, big stride out to drive down to long-off
straight line, tucked out through midwicket
another single pressed down to long-off
lets this slide across him and angles down to third man
length on off stump, forward press back to the bowler
fuller, driven without timing to mid-off
straighter line and worked to mid-on this time
steers this past midwicket from the crease
good length at the off stump, played forward into the covers
wider line, driven towards extra-cover and they take a sharp single
full length on the stumps, played firmly forward and very nearly chips a catch to the bowler's left hand, short of the fielder though
touch wider and worked into the gap at cover
full length on the off stump, flicked out down to long-on
poor ball leg side and whipped for four past short long leg
a foot outside off, tried to stay leg side to cut and missed, almost fell out of his ground as the bails were whipped off
back punching a shorter ball to long-on
forward press up on the leg side, they take a single to mid-on's right
wider line, slapped down to third man
length ball moving away from off stump, slashed at and missed
tightens the line and Ramdin gets right behind it to play back to the bowler
fuller and wide, nicely driven with good timing but too close to extra-cover who makes a nice save going to his left
length on a straight line, worked out through midwicket
around the wicket, played forward from off stump back to the bowler
swept well from off stump and timed through square leg
a little short and Carter is back in his crease to pull hard wide of deep midwicket but the fielder does really well going to his right, Rossouw with a nice dive
fuller and driven firmly out to deep cover
stays around, off stump line, flicked out through square leg
straight line, swept and gets it behind square, superb diving save from Tahir tearing across to his left
beats Carter straight away as he tries to cut the delivery
full outside off, strongly driven square through point to the sweeper
lovely placement, Steyn drifted onto the pads and it was expertly flicked away to bisect deep square and long leg
adjust the line, full on middle and off, defended towards mid on
outside off, played with an open face to point
137kph, comes forward and pushes to cover
full outside off, squeezed off the bottom of the bat to short third man
comes forward and defends to cover
dragged down short, he goes back and pulls with good placement to split long on and deep midwicet
and now he drives over cover, out of a reach of the leaping fielder, and it beats David Miller in the deep...went hard at the shot
short again, dragged from outside off to deep midwicket
full outside off, steps across the crease and works down to long on
clubs a length delivery over mid on and it plugs in the outfield, came off the bottom of the bat
pushed into the covers
some extra bounce beats the top edge as he tries to cut
short ball, over off stump, Carter sways out of the line
short outside off, 135kph, pulled to midwicket
hooks a short ball towards long leg, not far off carrying to the man near the boundary
full outside off, keeps a little low, prodded back to the bowler
dropped in short and at this pace that's a freebie, gets pulled over deep midwicket
pushed into the off side
full and worked down the ground
flicks a straight delivery to deep midwicket

oh dear, what's happened here...quality piece of cricket as Behardien ends up flat on sprawled across a length after delivery, sends down a full toss which is slapped through the covers. Ouch, seems he went over on his ankle. His spikes got stuck
round the wicket, worked through midwicket
drifts onto leg stump, bobbles to short fine leg
heaves across the line, he misses and so does de Villiers as it goes through his legs
pushed wide outside off, he swings hard and gets a thick outside edge fine of short third man
nicely bowled, held this one back, Carter a fraction early and gets a think inside edge to the leg side
worked through midwicket
starts full, jabbed into the leg side
sweeps strongly off leg stump out to deep square..he's rolled his wrists nicely on the sweep in this innings
a googly that spins sharply, takes the pad
works a straight delivery to midwicket
pushed across wide outside off
fuller delivery, he flicks his wrist and takes it down to long on
that's a cracking sweep, fetches it from outside off and deposits it into the stands over deep square
full outside off, pushed to mid off
guided to backward point where Rossouw makes a good save but it's a safe single
short ball, over middle and off, 135kph and Carter is beaten on the pull
beats him with a full one this time, drives outside the line and gets beaten on the inside edge
three strikes, this time over the top edge as he goes shorter and Carter tries to cut

picks out mid on...Steyn deserved that. Regardless of the match situation he has charged in, this was a short one, close to the body, cramped Carter for room as he pulled and it carried low towards the edge of the circle
low full toss, eased down to the ground to take him to fifty off 45 balls
oh boy, not the highest quality piece of cricket you'll see! But they all count for Tahir. It was a huge long hop, Russell went for the pull and couldn't have picked out deep midwicket any better
full outside off, driven square into the covers where it's parried
googly, played back to the bowler
worked off the pads to midwicket
low full toss pushed down to long on
back of a length, defended to the off side
full on off stump, Sammy caught back in the crease and has to drop his bat down quickly
well bowled, excellent short ball, takes the shoulder of the bat and flies down to third man
full on off stump, 143kph, driven to the left of mid on
superb yorker, Sammy has to be alert to get his bat down
shorter outside off, Sammy misses his cut as the ball keeps a little low
short of a length outside off, angled down to third man
short outside off, Sammy doesn't play at it
back of a length, nips in at Sammy who gets taken on the back leg
nearly finds third man, he's been in the firing line today, as Ramdin gets underneath the cut - never tried to keep it down - and it lands just in front of Kyle Abbott
pulled to long leg
takes inside edge and pad to the leg side
slog swept from just outside off, keeps low, beats the bat and slips under de Villiers' legs
off stump line, pressed from off stump down to long-on
floated up well outside off, square driven and times it nicely through point
goes to cut, gets a thick under edge which bounces up towards the stumps and Sammy kung-fu kicks it away!
cut again, this time out wide of deep cover for a couple
very full length, dug out a few inches into the leg side
bumper, good line, well ducked

heaved off a length from just outside off aiming leg side, sliced top edge out towards deep square where Faf du Plessis holds a fine catch. Difficult to judge that and he had to dive forward in the end but held on very well. Total miscue from the batsman, ran out of patience at this miserable situation
great yorker, beats the bat and shaves the off stump, almost perfect
not quite a yorker this time, driven to backward point
wide line on a good length, Sammy throws the kitchen sink at it and misses
shorter and a tighter line, forced off the back foot, gets a thick outside edge that flies where second slip might have been
flat delivery on off stump, blocked forward back to the bowler
floated up more and driven wide of the cover sweeper for a couple
googly, deceives the batsman playing forward, gets a thick inside edge that runs fine on the leg side
back on a fuller length, driven out to the sweeper
slider, just outside off, Sammy hanging back forcing to point
googly, turns sharply back and strikes the pad with Sammy deceived
length just outside off, driven at and missed
waited for and pressed down to long-on
just outside off, dabbed into the covers
full length at the off stump, driven steadily out to long-off
length ball on a straighter line, tries to flick it away but struck on the thigh pad
fuller length just outside off, blocked forward back to the bowler
full at the off stump, played forward towards mid-off and they take a single
length ball a foot wide of off stump, Sammy shaped for a big strike but left this alone
back of a length, keeps low as Sammy looks to pull and it goes under the bat
bumper, nips back into the body, Sammy turned his back on it and got struck on the shoulder
very full just outside off, driven away, hand by backward point and allows deep cover-point to chase around and save four
length ball, shapes back at the batsman who drops it down into midwicket
flat delivery just outside off, late cut to good effect, slips it past the keeper and runs away fine
fuller and straighter, punched up to mid-off
googly, not picked, played forward and gets the bat down just in time, thick inside edge to short long leg
back across the off stump, just tapping this back up the wicket
fuller length, whipped only to midwicket
more off stump line, worked up to extra-cover
full length wide of off stump, pressed at and missed, Steyn has some trouble with the footholds not the first today
knocks this into the covers and they take a sharp single and a direct hit at the non-striker's end would have effected the run out
straighter line, flicked back up the wicket inside mid-on and mid-off so they get a run
back of a length on the stumps, flicked out to deep square leg
similar delivery, this is turned down to long leg
full length wide of off stump, driven at and plays and misses, Steyn wants a caught behind appeal, no-one else does
floated up just outside off, driven on the bounce back to the bowler
googly, forced out to short third man as he got cramped up
full length just outside off, long stride out to defend back to the bowler
touch too short, back in front of off stump to dab and take a single to cover
fuller length, forward to drive out to deep cover
more air, spins away and beats the drive of Holder
forward just outside off, driven at and gets a thick outside edge past slip and Tahir does really well out on the boundary to save four
two feet outside off on a length, left alone
tighter line, driven straight to backward point
drops the length and Holders pulls for four backward of square!!
back on a full length wide of off stump, driven out to deep cover
wide line and left alone
full length on off stump and Holder strikes beautifully through the line, what timing, inside mid-off races away
back of a length outside off, keeps the hands inside the line
shorter and now a wide
fuller length, moves away a tad and beats the outside edge with Holder trying to drive through cover
tighter line, gets a bat on this to drive to extra-cover
short again, right at the batsman who's up on his toes to drop at his feet, well played
length ball on off stump, blocked back to the bowler, what a nondescript end!
